meanings.definition: The sport of fighting with swords.
meanings.sent1: In fencing, athletes use swords to compete against each other.
meanings.sent2: I watched a fencing match at the Olympics.
meanings.sent3: The fencing tournament was filled with excitement and skill.
meanings.sent4: Her quick wit was her best fencing weapon during debates.
meanings.sent5: The sound of clashing swords filled the fencing arena.

meanings.definition: The act of surrounding an area with a fence.
meanings.sent1: The farmer spent the day fencing his property to keep the animals safe.
meanings.sent2: The fencing around the garden kept the rabbits out.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog managed to escape the fencing and run wild.
meanings.sent4: The wooden fencing added a rustic charm to the backyard.
meanings.sent5: The fencing along the border provided security and privacy.

meanings.definition: The act of buying and selling stolen goods.
meanings.sent1: The authorities cracked down on fencing operations in the city.
meanings.sent2: He was arrested for involvement in fencing stolen jewelry.
meanings.sent3: The bumbling thief tried his hand at fencing but was caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: The underground fencing network was finally exposed by the police.
meanings.sent5: She unknowingly purchased a stolen painting from a fencing ring.
